_exec_summary.SummaryText:
through 68.87.  In addition, the Irishtown facility will voluntarily comply with the Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations (29 CFR 1910.119). The required elements of the RMP Program Level 3 prevention program are listed below: 



     Employee Participation

     Process Safety Information

     Process Hazard Analysis

     Operating Procedures

     Training

     Contractors

     Pre-startup Safety Review

     Mechanical Integrity

     Hot Work Permit

     Management of Change

     Incident Investigation

     Compliance Audits



These items, their specific requirements, and how the Irishtown facility complies with the requirements are addressed in the Risk Management Program & Process Safety Management Program Manual. In addition, the Manual addresses the facility's actions as a non-responding site to address the Emergency Response requirements of 40 CFR 68.90.



<> The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:

The Irishtown facility has had no RMP reportable incident in the previous five years. 



<> The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:

In the event of an emergency, facility employees will notify the local emergency responders identified in the Emergency Action Plan to respond and will evacuate when needed.  Additional details related to emergency procedures can be located in the facility's Emergency Action Plan that is included in Section 4 of the Risk Management Program & Process Safety Management Program Manual.



<> Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:

The facility completed a process hazard analysis in July 2017 which identified several recommendations for enhanced process safety. These recommendations are summarized in the PHA report and are currently under evaluation.
